snippet.textDisplay: NOTHING has given me the same feeling Skies of Arcadia gave me the first time (and many subsequent times) I played it through. I still do a playthrough once every year or so just to reimmerse myself in the world of Arcadia. I have been playing video games 28 years and never came across anything like it, the sense of being an explorer and discovering the world. This one theme, every time I hear it, makes me want to remake Horteka in Unreal or Godot and show it to Sega and say "come on guys, the world is ready for an HD remake."
snippet.textOriginal: NOTHING has given me the same feeling Skies of Arcadia gave me the first time (and many subsequent times) I played it through. I still do a playthrough once every year or so just to reimmerse myself in the world of Arcadia. I have been playing video games 28 years and never came across anything like it, the sense of being an explorer and discovering the world. This one theme, every time I hear it, makes me want to remake Horteka in Unreal or Godot and show it to Sega and say "come on guys, the world is ready for an HD remake."

snippet.textDisplay: @Lucky NoDice Agreed... I played this for the first time when I was 13 (2001) years old and it blew me away. The airship battles/upgrades, all of the port and character designs, and especially the music tracks like this! One of my favorite games to this day (even if the story is basically Star Wars... which, come to think of it, is admittedly by George Lucas actually point-for-point Joseph Campbell's "The Hero's Journey" so...)!
snippet.textOriginal: @Lucky NoDice Agreed... I played this for the first time when I was 13 (2001) years old and it blew me away. The airship battles/upgrades, all of the port and character designs, and especially the music tracks like this! One of my favorite games to this day (even if the story is basically Star Wars... which, come to think of it, is admittedly by George Lucas actually point-for-point Joseph Campbell's "The Hero's Journey" so...)!

snippet.textDisplay: Everything you're imagining is probably exactly the way it happened. That is, if you're imagining a guy in a smiley cell-phone suit grooving on the corner of a busy street in a small town, spinning around and waving merrily to passers-by... I also danced to the Paya-Paya song from Radiata Stories. Look it up and indulge your imagination further for continued hilarity. I'm drunk as fuck. Okay.

snippet.textDisplay:
Skies is a quite the delicacy to be sure. The story will leave you drooling for more, but the battle system will leave you clambering for a white map. (=P kudos if you know what I'm talking about- legends fans)
Skies has got to be probably one of my all-time favorites, but it's one of those RPG's that get to be just a little too much work to play-through for through  umpteenth time. Music is perfect though, better even then TOS even IMO.

thumbs up if you want a remake!
snippet.textOriginal:
Skies is a quite the delicacy to be sure. The story will leave you drooling for more, but the battle system will leave you clambering for a white map. (=P kudos if you know what I'm talking about- legends fans)
Skies has got to be probably one of my all-time favorites, but it's one of those RPG's that get to be just a little too much work to play-through for through  umpteenth time. Music is perfect though, better even then TOS even IMO.

thumbs up if you want a remake!

snippet.textDisplay: Thumbs up if you would leave behind the internet, video games, and everything else this world has to offer to be an air pirate in Arcadia.

snippet.textDisplay: Well, I've gotta say the OST from this games was so-so, with many repetitive themes... save for that one! I mean, what's not awesome with this Indian-inspired song full of flutes and drums? It makes me wanna ride Ixa-Taka again, just to get lost in its maze... and enjoy that game, over and over again... I can't describe the feelings I have when playing this game, so as when I'm playing Chrono Trigger. INSTANT CLASSIC!
snippet.textOriginal: Well, I've gotta say the OST from this games was so-so, with many repetitive themes... save for that one! I mean, what's not awesome with this Indian-inspired song full of flutes and drums? It makes me wanna ride Ixa-Taka again, just to get lost in its maze... and enjoy that game, over and over again... I can't describe the feelings I have when playing this game, so as when I'm playing Chrono Trigger. INSTANT CLASSIC!

snippet.textDisplay:
Horrible? The Gamecube version's music was indeed downgraded, but it wasn't rendered awful. It was still great. Just not Dreamcast great.

Both Dreamcast and Gamecube versions music was good. Just because one sounds better doesn't mean the other sounds crappy.

Oddly though, I ended up prefering one Valuan theme in it's GC version.
snippet.textOriginal:
Horrible? The Gamecube version's music was indeed downgraded, but it wasn't rendered awful. It was still great. Just not Dreamcast great.

Both Dreamcast and Gamecube versions music was good. Just because one sounds better doesn't mean the other sounds crappy.

Oddly though, I ended up prefering one Valuan theme in it's GC version.

snippet.textDisplay:
I said it's better in every other respect, I hardly completely dismissed the Gamecube version. Of course it's still a great game, it's just that the soundtrack was easily one of the best things about the game. While the superb composition remained, a significant part of the 'epic' feeling the game held had been dilluted.

As a result, despite the enhancements of the Gamecube version, when reccomending this game, I always point towards the Dreamcast version as the definitive experience.
snippet.textOriginal:
I said it's better in every other respect, I hardly completely dismissed the Gamecube version. Of course it's still a great game, it's just that the soundtrack was easily one of the best things about the game. While the superb composition remained, a significant part of the 'epic' feeling the game held had been dilluted.

As a result, despite the enhancements of the Gamecube version, when reccomending this game, I always point towards the Dreamcast version as the definitive experience.

snippet.textDisplay: gamecube version wasn't much worse... it was still a great game.. you make it sound ruined but thats bullshit

snippet.textDisplay: I was told that the reason the GC soundtrack was so mangled was due the compression used. They had to compress the data (video and audio) from two discs into one. This is why Gamecubes soundtrack sounds so horrible.
snippet.textOriginal: I was told that the reason the GC soundtrack was so mangled was due the compression used. They had to compress the data (video and audio) from two discs into one. This is why Gamecubes soundtrack sounds so horrible.
